OpenCms ships with a default configuration for indexed fields that is optimized w.r.t. the structure of OpenCms resources. So, for example, properties are already indexed. What is impossible to capture by a default configuration are the following decisions:

  • Which schema elements of a structured content should be mapped to special index fields (of special type)?
  • Should an XML content be findable as the content itself, or only the container-page the content is located on?

The answer to both questions is mainly specific to your use-case. Thus you have to choose the settings by yourself. As use cases you may regard:

  • If you have detail pages for contents, it is usually intended to find the content as its own. Otherwise this may be not the case.
  • If you want to have facets, you may map schema elements to special fields that you use for faceting.

By default

  • The content of all schema elements of one language version will be stored in one language-specific text field called content_{locale}, e.g., content_en.
  • The content is index such, that it can be found stand-alone.
